intro: Peristylus gracilis, commonly known as the slender peristylus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and along stream banks. Its slender stems and lance-shaped leaves contribute to its graceful appearance. Peristylus gracilis is often found in wetland habitats and is adapted to thrive in humid, temperate climates.
